## BTree

BTree main class

### Parameters

-   `attr` **(BTreeRootAttrStruct | BTreeValueAttrStruct | [string][88] \| [number][89])** Can be of type object, string, number. In case of object root/value property is expected to be value of root node.

### Examples

```javascript
new BTree(10);
new BTree({ root: 10 });
new BTree({ value: 10 });
```

### root

Root node of the binary tree.

Type: [BTreeNode][90]

### depth

Depth of the binary tree.

Type: [number][89]

### iterator

Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the tree.

#### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
for (const node of tree) {
 console.log(node.value); // 10
}
```

## toString

Returns string value of given tree.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.insert(30);
tree.toString(); // "10102030"
```

## toJSON

Returns JSON Form.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.toJSON(); // {value:10,lNode:{value:20,lNode:null,rNode:null},rNode:null}
```

Returns **BTreeNodeStruct** Returns json form of a given tree.

## toArray

Returns array value.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.toArray(); // => [{value:10,...},{value:20,...}]
```

Returns **[Array][91]&lt;[BTreeNode][90]>** Returns array form of given tree.

## toFlatArray

Returns array of values of the tree.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.toFlatArray(); // => [10,20]
```

Returns **[Array][91]&lt;any>** Returns array form of given tree.

## insert

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free left child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.insert(30);
tree.toString(); // "10102030"
```

Returns **[BTreeNode][90]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## insertLeftMost

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free left child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

Returns **[BTreeNode][90]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## insertRightMost

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free right child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

Returns **[BTreeNode][90]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## delete

Deletes given value from tree.
Travarsal = Root -> L -> R.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** Value to be removed.

Returns **[BTreeNode][90]** Returns removed BTreeNode.

## insertAt

Inserts given element at given location. If location is already taken then it does not insert any value.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** value to insert.
-   `index` **[number][89]** index at which to append new element to.

### Examples

```javascript
tree.insertAt(20,2);
```

-   Throws **any** UnreachableError

## traverseBFS

Breadth first search. Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in BFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][92]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][93]** no value.

## traverseDFS

Depth first search, Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in DFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][92]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][93]** no value.

## each

Breadth first search. Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in BFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][92]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][93]** no value.

## forEach

Breadth first search. Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in BFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][92]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][93]** no value.

## entries

Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the tree.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
for (const [index, node] of tree.entries()) {
 console.log(index, node.value); // 0, 10
}
```

Returns **IterableIterator&lt;\[[number][89], [BTreeNode][90]]>** Iterable for iterations.

## map

Maps current tree values to a new tree with modifying the values using given callback function.
Uses BFS.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][92]** callback function for value modifier.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var tree2 = tree.map(n => n * 2);
var arr2 = tree2.toArray(); // [{value:20,...},{value:40,...},{value:60,...},{value:80,...}]
```

Returns **[BTree][94]** A new BTree

## filter

Filters each item based on given filter function

### Parameters

-   `filterFnc` **[Function][92]** callback function for filtering purpose.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var tree2 = tree.filter(n => !!(n % 4 === 0 || n === 10));
var arr2 = tree2.toArray(); // [{value:10,...},{value:20,...},{value:40,...}]
```

-   Throws **any** FilteredRootError, Error when root node gets filtered out.

Returns **[BTree][94]** New filtered instance of tree.

## reduce

Reduces each node values using reduceFunction and returns final value.

### Parameters

-   `reduceFunction` **[Function][92]** callback function for reducing each node value to a final value.
-   `initialValue` **([number][89] | any)** Optional, Accumulator/Initial value.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var sum = tree.reduce((acc, node) => acc + node); // => 100
```

Returns **any** Returns reduceed value

## reverse

Reverses the current Binary Tree, Left Node becomes Right node and vise versa.
Does not return new instance, returns current tree instance.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]);
tree.reverse().toArray(); // => [10, 30, 20, 70, 60, 50, 40, 80]
```

Returns **[BTree][94]** Returns current tree instance.

## indexOf

Returns first index of a value matched, if it is not present, it returns -1.

### Parameters

-   `value` **any** Any value to find.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]);
tree.indexOf(30); // => 3
tree.indexOf(51); // => -1
```

Returns **[number][89]** Returns index of given item.

## includes

Checks if given item exists or not, returns boolean.

### Parameters

-   `value` **any** Any value to check if it exists or not.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]);
tree.includes(30); // true
tree.includes(51); // false
```

Returns **[boolean][95]** Returns true if it is present, otherwise false.

## exists

Checks if given item exists or not, returns boolean.

### Parameters

-   `value` **any** Any value to check if it exists or not.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]);
tree.exists(30); // true
tree.exists(51); // false
```

Returns **[boolean][95]** Returns true if it is present, otherwise false.

## has

Checks if given item exists or not, returns boolean.

### Parameters

-   `value` **any** Any value to check if it exists or not.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]);
tree.has(30); // true
tree.has(51); // false
```

Returns **[boolean][95]** Returns true if it is present, otherwise false.

## sort

Sorts the tree based on compare function, Has option to sort only at children level.

### Parameters

-   `compareFnc` **[Function][92]** Function used to determine the order of the elements. It is expected to return
    a negative value if first argument is less than second argument, zero if they're equal and a positive
    value otherwise. If omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, ASCII character order.```ts
    (a, b) => a - b)
    ```
-   `atOnlyFirstChildLevel` **[boolean][95]** Optiona, Flag to specify if first child of each node should sorted. Default is `false`.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 200, 100, 50, 60, 90, 5, 3]);
tree.sort().toFlatArray(); // => [3,5,10,50,60,90,100,200]
```

Returns **[undefined][93]** Returns undefined.

## print

Prints entire tree on the console, useful for logging and checking status.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([1, 2, 3]);
tree.print();
1 (1)
|- 2 (2)
|- 3 (3)
```

Returns **[undefined][93]** Returns undefined.

## find

Returns the first matched tree node. Traverses using BFS.

### Parameters

-   `item` **any** any value to find inside the tree.

Returns **[BTreeNode][90]** Returns the first matched tree node, if not found, returns null.

## getIndexFromPath

Returns index value from given path.

### Parameters

-   `path` **[Array][91]&lt;(`"U"` \| `"L"` \| `"R"`)>** Array for U L or R, which represents the quickest path to get to a node.

Returns **[number][89]** Returns index value.

## getPathFromIndex

Returns Path equivalent to the given index.

### Parameters

-   `index` **[number][89]** Index number from which path to be calculated.

Returns **[Array][91]&lt;(`"U"` \| `"L"` \| `"R"`)>** Path equivalent to the given index.

## fromArray

Converts given values into a Binary Tree.

### Parameters

-   `arr` **any** Any array of values.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10,20,30,40]);
```

Returns **[BTree][94]** Newly generated tree.

## BTreeNode

Binary Tree node class, contains 2 child nodes and single value.

### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 15 });
var node3 = new BTreeNode({ value: 30 });
var node2 = new BTreeNode({ value: 20, rNode: node, lNode: node3 });
console.log(node2.lNode.value); // 30
```

### value

Type: T

### lNode

Type: [BTreeNode][90]

### rNode

Type: [BTreeNode][90]

### validate

Validates a BTree node, it must have a valid value (no undefined nor null).

#### Examples

```javascript
new BTreeNode(); // throws error saying `A BTree node must have a valid value, cannot be null or undefined`
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
console.log(node.validate()); // true
```

Returns **[boolean][95]** 

### toJSON

Converts current node and all children nodes in json format.

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: lNode });
console.log(node.toJSON()); // {value:15,lNode: {value: 10,lNode:null,rNode:null},rNode:null}
```

Returns **BTreeNodeStruct** 

### toString

Converts current node and all children nodes in json format and append them together.
Goes in direction of U -> L -> R

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: node });
console.log(node.toString()); // "1015"
```

Returns **[string][88]** 

### getDepth

Returns depth of its children.
Goes in direction of L -> R

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: node });
var l2Node = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: lNode });
console.log(l2Node.getDepth()); // 3
```

Returns **[number][89]**
